AccentedSort! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.BBjGridExWidgetOptions
Set to true to specify that the sort should take into account accented characters, if this feature is turned on the sort will perform slower·

AutoGroupColumnDefinition! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.BBjGridExWidgetOptions
Allows specifying the group 'auto column' if you are not happy with the default· If grouping, this column def is included as the first column definition in the grid· If not grouping, this column is not included·
#Configuration
#GridRerender
AutoHeight! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.Columns.BBjGridExWidgetDefaultColumnDefinition
Set to true to have the grid calculate height of row based on contents of this column·
#Configuration
#ColumnsRerender
AutoSizePadding! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.BBjGridExWidgetOptions
How many pixels to add to a column width after the auto-sizing calculation· The default is 4 pixels· Set this if you want to add extra room to accommodate (for example) sort icons, or some other dynamic nature of the header·
#Configuration
#GridRerender

A constant which defines column chart series
ChartType! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.Columns.BBjGridExWidgetDefaultColumnDefinition
Defines the chart data type that should be used for a column· There are two types of charting ranges; a category range that is highlighted in green and a series range that is highlighted in blue· A category range can only contain cells from a single column, whereas a series range can contain values from many columns· Columns can be explicitly configured or left for the grid to infer the type based on the data contained in the cells where columns containing string values will map to 'categories' and columns containing number values will map to 'series' charting columns·
#Configuration
#ColumnsRerender.

DeltaColumnMode! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.BBjGridExWidgetOptions
By default when new columns are loaded into the grid, the following properties (Order, Aggregation Function , Width , Pivot , Row Group , Pinned ) are not used To change this behaviour and have column attributes above take effect each time the grid updates the columns, then set this option to true

GroupIncludeFooter! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.BBjGridExWidgetOptions
If grouping, whether to show a group footer when the group is expanded· If true, then by default, the footer will contain aggregate data (if any) when shown and the header will be blank· When closed, the header will contain the aggregate data regardless of this setting (as footer is hidden anyway)· This is handy for 'total' rows, that are displayed below the data when the group is open, and alongside the group when it is closed
#Configuration
#GridRerender
GroupIncludeTotalFooter! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.BBjGridExWidgetOptions
Set to true to show a 'grand' total group footer across all groups·
#Configuration
#GridRerender
GroupMultiAutoColumn! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.BBjGridExWidgetOptions
If using auto column, set to true to have each group in its own column separate column, eg if group by Country then Year, two auto columns will be created, one for country and one for year
#Configuration
#GridRerender

When true, selecting a group will have the impact of selecting all its children When false, then the group is selectable independently of the child nodes·

GroupSuppressAutoColumn! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.BBjGridExWidgetOptions
If true, the grid will not swap in the grouping column when grouping is enabled· Use this if you want complete control on the column displayed and don't want the grids help· In other words, you already have a column in your column definitions that is responsible for displaying the groups

GroupSuppressBlankHeader! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.BBjGridExWidgetOptions
If true, and showing footer, aggregate data will be displayed at both the header and footer levels always· This stops the possibly undesirable behaviour of the header details 'jumping' to the footer on expand·

GroupSuppressRow! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.BBjGridExWidgetOptions
If true, the group row won't be displayed and the groups will be expanded by default with no ability to expand / contract the groups· Useful when you want to just 'group' the rows, but not add parent group row to each group
#Configuration
#GridRerender
GroupUseEntireRow! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.BBjGridExWidgetOptions
If grouping, set to true or false (default is false)· If true, a group row will span all columns across the entire width of the table· If false, the cells will be rendered as normal and you will have the opportunity to include a grouping column (normally the first on the left) to show the group

Icons! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.BBjGridExWidgetOptions
Icons to use inside the grid instead of the grid's default icons· The icons can either be set on the grid options (all icons) or on the column definition (all except group)· If defined in both the grid options and column definitions, the column definition will get used· This allows you to specify defaults in the grid options to fall back on, and then provide individual icons for specific columns· This is handy if, for example, you want to include 'A··Z' as string sort icons and just the simple arrow for other columns·
#Configuration
#GridRerender.
Icons! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.Columns.BBjGridExWidgetDefaultColumnDefinition
Icons to use inside the column instead of the grid's default icons· The icons can either be set on the grid options (all icons) or on the column definition (all except group)· If defined in both the grid options and column definitions, the column definition will get used· This allows you to specify defaults in the grid options to fall back on, and then provide individual icons for specific columns· This is handy if, for example, you want to include 'A··Z' as string sort icons and just the simple arrow for other columns·

#ColumnsRerender.

Rules which can be applied to include certain CSS classes for rows· These rules are provided as a JavaScript map where the keys are class names and the values are expressions that if evaluated to true, the class gets used· The expression is a string which is treated as a shorthand for a function by the grid.
#Configuration
#GridRerender.
RowDeselection! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.BBjGridExWidgetOptions
Set to true or false· If true, then rows will be deselected if you hold down ctrl + click the row· Normal behaviour with the grid disallows deselection of nodes (ie once a row is selected, it remains selected until another row is selected in its place)·
#Configuration

RowGroupIndex! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.Columns.BBjGridExWidgetDefaultColumnDefinition
Set this in columns you want to group by· If only grouping by one column, set this to any number (eg 0)· If grouping by multiple columns, set this to where you want this column to be in the group (eg 0 for first, 1 for second, and so on)·
#Configuration
#ColumnsRerender
RowGroupPanelShow! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.BBjGridExWidgetOptions
When to show the 'row group panel' (where you drag rows to group) at the top· Default is never· Set to either 'always' or 'onlyWhenGrouping'
#Configuration
#GridRerender
RowHeight! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.BBjGridExWidgetOptions
Default Row Height in pixels· Default is 25 pixels·
#Configuration
#API
RowMultiSelectWithClick! - Variable in class BBjGridExWidget.BBjGridExWidgetOptions
Set to true to allow multiple rows to be selected with a single click· E·g· if you click select one row, then click select another row, the first row will keep it's selection· Clicking a selected row in this mode will deselect the row· This is useful for touch devices where ctrl and shift clicking is not an option·
#Configuration
#GridRerender
Note that Despite the setting name , it works when MultipleSelection is enabled or disabled
